chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Adrian O Jefferson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
IF REVOKED: 2 days credit granted.
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
Costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
To be determined at restitution hearing - 10/20/2022 @ 9:30 am
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Not to use or possess of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 
No contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint.
Provide DNA Sample if not previously posted.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

timeConds.notes:
With Huber, standard release conditions.
Commencing FORTHWITH.
Complete Community service hours during probation term as directed by agent.

records.addlTxt: Restitution hearing on December 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

dated 09-27-2022, filed by the State requesting an adjournment of the Restitution hearing scheduled for 10-20-2022

**Reviewed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on 09-29-2022: The matter may be rescheduled.**

1:33 PM Defendant Adrian O Jefferson in court.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for Adrian O Jefferson.  Prosecuting attorney Ted Szczupakiewicz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
All parties are ready to proceed to sentencing today. 
State gives sentencing recommendation. 
Defense gives sentencing recommendation. 
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

Court orders the following:
Total Prison: 3 YEARS
Initial Confinement: 18 MONTHS
Extended Supervision: 18 MONTHS
2 Days Credit if revoked.

If revoked:
Defendant is  eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is  eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  

  STAYED for PROBATION
Term of Probation:3 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
 100 hours of community service
 No use of any dangerous weapons
 AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
 Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
 No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
 No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
 Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
 Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
 No contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint
 DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

RESTITUTION:  TBD at hearing
COSTS:  $268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 60 DAYS Waukesha County Jail with Huber, all standard work release conditions.  Defendant remanded into custody today after court to commence serving condition time.

Any monies on deposit to be applied towards restitution and held in this matter until the restitution hearing date.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Restitution hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Restitution hearing on October 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Sentencing hearing on August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

08:48 AM Defendant Adrian O Jefferson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State recited offer on the record; defense confirmed.  Court conducted colloquy with defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 is dismissed and read-in.    Defense requests a Pre-Sentence investigation.  State does not object.  Court orders a Pre-Sentence Investigation and sets matter for a Sentencing hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
